description:
When Windows XP launched on August 24, 2001, the official system requirements included a computer with a Pentium processor of at least 233MHz, 64MB of working memory, and 1.5 GB of storage space.

Now, however, Techspot reports that a German modder calling himself “Dietmar” has managed to get Windows XP Professional SP 3 working on an old computer from 1989 with an Intel 486 processor at 90MHz.
title: Modder gets Windows XP running on an ancient computer from 1989

description:
Today’s RGB lighting solutions are out of this world in terms of quality, especially when we’re talking about a brand like Govee.

Down from its original price of $150 and now available for just $90 (with an additional $5 off if you snip the Amazon coupon), the Govee Lyra RGBIC Corner Floor Lamp is the perfect addition to your living space.

With 16 million colors to choose from and adjustable brightness up to 1500 lumens, you can create the perfect ambience for any occasion.

Imagine hosting a movie night and setting up a perfectly dimmed
title: Save $60 on Govee’s Lyra Lamp and bring RBG lighting into your home

description:
Trackpads on laptops have come a long way over the years, and that does double for Windows machines. These input devices used to be tiny, sluggish, and only able to detect a single touch input. Naturally, mice were more efficient in those days, but modern Windows trackpads support myriad gestures to make your computing experience more efficient.

In fact, you might not even know all the cool things your trackpad can do in Windows 11. Let’s dig in.

Further reading: The best laptops we’ve tested

Windows on tap

If you’ve always been a single-finger trackpad user, you can start slow with advanced tapping. Instead of clicking the
title: Do you know your laptop’s trackpad gestures? They’re surprisingly helpful
